data.name: Bouffalant

attacks.name: Double Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.

data.name: Bouffalant

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Head Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

data.name: Bouffalant

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Head Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

data.name: Bouffalant

abilities.name: Sap Sipper
abilities.text: This Pokémon's attacks do 40 more damage to your opponent's Grass Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Derail
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

data.name: Bouffalant

abilities.name: Bouffer
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Gold Breaker
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a trail.

data.name: Bouffalant

attacks.name: Bouffant Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

data.flavorText: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.

data.name: Bouffalant

attacks.name: Tool Breaker
attacks.text: Discard a Pokémon Tool card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They are known to charge so wildly that if a train were to enter their territory, they would send it flying.

data.name: Bouffalant

abilities.name: Sap Sipper
abilities.text: This Pokémon's attacks do 60 more damage to your opponent's Grass Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Head Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

data.name: Bouffalant

attacks.name: Lost Headbutt
attacks.text: Put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon in the Lost Zone.

data.flavorText: These Pokémon can crush a car with no more than a headbutt. Bouffalant with more hair on their heads hold higher positions within the herd.

data.name: Bouffalant

abilities.name: Bouffer
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Damage Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: These Pokémon live in herds of about 20 individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will lose the hair on their heads for some reason.

abilities.name: Curly Wall
abilities.text: As long as you have at least 1 other Bouffalant in play, all of your Basic Colorless Pokémon take 60 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). The effect of Curly Wall doesn't stack.

attacks.name: Boundless Power
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Bouffalant

abilities.name: Curly Wall
abilities.text: As long as you have at least 1 other Bouffalant in play, all of your Basic Colorless Pokémon take 60 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). The effect of Curly Wall doesn't stack.

attacks.name: Boundless Power
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.flavorText: These Pokémon can crush a car with no more than a headbutt. Bouffalant with more hair on their heads hold higher positions within the herd.

attacks.name: Ready to Ram
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 6 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Smashing Headbutt
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Bouffalant ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex, this attack does 100 more damage.
